  • Reference

American and National League statistics

Source: R/data.R
NLbatting.Rd

Batting and pitching statistics for all American and National League teams in the 2011 season.

Usage

NLbatting

ALbatting

NLpitching

Format

Tm

team abbreviation

NBat

number of players

BatAge

average age

R.G

runs scored per game

G

games played

PA

plate appearances

AB

at-bats

R

runs scored

H

hits

X2B

doubles

X3B

triples

HR

home runs

RBI

runs batted in

SB

stolen bases

CS

caught stealing

BB

walks

SO

strikeouts

BA

batting average

OBP

on-base percentage

SLG

slugging percentage

OPS

on-base percentage plus slugging percentage

OPS.

relative OPS statistic

TB

total bases

GDP

grounded into double play

HBP

hit by pitch

SH

sacrifice hits

SF

sacrifice flies

IBB

intentional walks

An object of class spec_tbl_df (inherits from tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) with 14 rows and 28 columns.

Tm

team abbreviation

NPitch

number of pitchers

PitchAge

average age

R.G

runs allowed per game

W

wins

L

losses

W.L.

winning fraction

ERA

earned run average

G

games played

GS

games started

GF

games finished

CG

complete games

tmSHO

team shutouts

cgSHO

complete game shutouts

SV

saves

IP

innings pitched

H

hits

R

runs allowed

ER

earned runs allowed

HR

home runs

BB

walks

IBB

intentional walks

SO

strikeouts

HBP

hit by pitch

BK

balks

WP

wild pitches

BF

batters faced

ERA.

relative ERA

WHIP

hits and walks per nine innings

H.9

hits per nine innings

HR.9

home runs per nine innings

BB.9

walks per nine innings

SO.9

strikeouts per nine innings

SO.BB

ratio of strikeouts to walks

Source

Baseball-Reference: https://www.baseball-reference.com/leagues/NL/2011.shtml
